Package controller

Class AllAppointmentsScreenController

java.lang.Object
controller.AllAppointmentsScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AllAppointmentsScreenController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the controller class for the AllAppointmentsScreen.fxml document and is not meant to be instantiated. This class populates the data for the Appointments table, as well as provide the functionality for the buttons, radio buttons and combo boxes on the screen.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is called by the FXMLLoader.load() call contained in the toAllAppointmentsScreen() method of the AdminHomeScreenController class. The method initially populates the table with every Appointment that is in the database.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      resourceBundle - An unreferenced ResourceBundle object passed automatically
      url - An unreferenced URL object passed automatically

    • searchAppointments

      public void searchAppointments(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is an event handler on the searchTextField. Search function searches the corresponding Appointment List for matches containing the appointmentID, customerID, title or customerName.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the text field.

    • toAdminHomeScreen

      public void toAdminHomeScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler for the Back button that sends the program back to the AdminHomeScreen. The method loads the FXML document for the AdminHomeScreen, passes that to a new scene and then sets the stage with the new scene.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Back button.
      Throws:
      IOException - The FXMLLoader.load() call will throw this exception if the FXML document can't be found.

    • loadAllAppointments

      public void loadAllAppointments(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method loads the appointmentsTable with both completed and scheduled appointments.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the radio button.

    • loadUpcomingAppointments

      public void loadUpcomingAppointments(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method loads the appointmentsTable with upcoming scheduled appointments.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the radio button.

    • loadCompletedAppointments

      public void loadCompletedAppointments(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method loads the appointmentsTable with appointments that have already been completed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the radio button.

    • toAdminCreateAppointmentScreen

      public void toAdminCreateAppointmentScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler on the Create New Appointment button. When clicked, the button redirects the program to the AdminCreateEditAppointmentScreen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Create New Appointment button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file

    • toAdminEditAppointmentScreen

      public void toAdminEditAppointmentScreen(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler on the Edit Appointment button. When clicked, the button redirects the program to the AdminCreateEditAppointmentScreen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Edit Appointment button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file

    • deleteAppointment

      public void deleteAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      This method is an event handler on the "Delete Appointment" button. When clicked, the button prompts the user to confirm they wish to delete the selected appointment and once confirmed, the appointment is deleted from the database.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the "Delete Appointment" button.
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • customDateRange

      public void customDateRange(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method loads the appointmentsTable with appointments that fall within the specified custom date range.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the submit button.

    • toSignOut

      public void toSignOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler on the SignOut button. When clicked, the button redirects the program to the original Login Screen
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the SignOut button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file
